alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 3:10PM EST until further notice by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-231600- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.Y.0006.220222T2010Z-000000T0000Z/ /PTTP1.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 310 PM EST Tue Feb 22 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods. At 23.0 feet, Clemente Park is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18 feet by late Wednesday afternoon, and continue to 19.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will waver some Friday before rising to 22.5 feet Saturday morning before falling. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
